H0.text: An isolated system is a sealed, vacuum‑insulated reaction flask that approximates a condition in which neither matter nor heat can be exchanged between the system and its surroundings.

H1.text: Shared system is a condition that a sealed, vacuum‑insulated reaction flask approximates, in which neither matter nor heat can be exchanged between system and surroundings.

H2.text: Changing system is the condition approximated by a sealed, vacuum‑insulated reaction flask, in which neither matter nor heat can be exchanged between the system and its surroundings.

H3.text: Sure system is a sealed, vacuum‑insulated reaction flask that approximates a condition in which neither matter nor heat can be exchanged between the system and the surroundings.
